summary: The concept of "prize for excellence," redirected to the preferred term "honour," pertains to awards recognizing outstanding achievements within the EU framework. These prizes often take the form of tokens, medals, or other symbols of merit, which may be denominated in various currencies, including euro. Such awards are designed to circulate among citizens, promoting values like innovation and commitment. Legal specifications govern the design and distribution of these awards, ensuring compliance with copyright laws to avoid unlawful reproductions. Infringements can lead to sanctions, reinforcing the integrity of the honour bestowed. Participating entities must adhere to requisite standards, ensuring that the features of the awards reflect their esteemed status.
